title: How to solve this (look at the link for the picture of the circuit). R1 = R2 = 60Ω), R3 = 250Ω, R4 = 325Ω and Vsource = 35 V. What is the current - Quora

response.answer_text: Here’s how you solve it. calculate the equivalent resistance of the two parallel pairs. That leaves you with:three resistances in series. Calculate the sum of those three.you now have one single equivalent resistance. Apply Ohm’s Law to calculate the current.It’s really pretty easy. If you work out your answer and put it in the comments, I’ll let you know if you’re right or not.

Notice that R1 and R2 are in parallel. Also, notice that R4 and R5 are in parallel. Using the parallel formulas that are available to you, solve for the total resistance of those two parts of the circuit. What you will have left is three series resistors. Add those together to arrive at the total resistance of the circuit. Finally, using Ohm’s Law, solve for the total current in the circuit.
Calculate Ra = R1 || R2. Where symbol “||” means “in parallel with”.Calculate Rb = R4 || R5Now you have simple network of Ra + R3 + RbFrom this calculate the total current.I hope this helps
